commented_code:
# CHANGELOG
 
+## 4.8.0
+
+The Sentry SDK team is happy to announce the immediate availability of Sentry PHP SDK v4.8.0.
+
+### Features
+
+- Add timing span when emiting a timing metric [(#1717)](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-php/pull/1717)

discussion_comments.commented_code:

+
+### Features

+- Add timing span when emiting a timing metric [(#1717)](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-php/pull/1717)

commented_code:
+

+ + + +

+ +# Contributing to the Sentry PHP SDK + +We welcome contributions to sentry-php by the community. See the [Contributing to Docs](https://docs.sentry.io/contributing/) page if you want to fix or update the documentation on the website. + +## How to report a problem + +Please search the [issue tracker](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-php/issues) before creating a new issue (a problem or an improvement request). Please also ask in our [Sentry Community on Discord](https://discord.com/invite/Ww9hbqr) before submitting a new issue. There is a ton of great people in our Discord community ready to help you! + +If you feel that you can fix or implement it yourself, please read a few paragraphs below to learn how to submit your changes.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@ +

+ + + +

+ +# Contributing to the Sentry PHP SDK + +We welcome contributions to sentry-php by the community. See the [Contributing to Docs](https://docs.sentry.io/contributing/) page if you want to fix or update the documentation on the website. + +## How to report a problem + +Please search the [issue tracker](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-php/issues) before creating a new issue (a problem or an improvement request). Please also ask in our [Sentry Community on Discord](https://discord.com/invite/Ww9hbqr) before submitting a new issue. There is a ton of great people in our Discord community ready to help you! + +If you feel that you can fix or implement it yourself, please read a few paragraphs below to learn how to submit your changes.
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Looking at this we might want to make it something like this since this line actually seems straight from sentry-docs which is a little wierd and seems worden a little janky at the moment.

```suggestion
We welcome contributions to `sentry-php` by the community. Read on if you want to fix or add features to the Sentry PHP SDK.
```

```suggestion
# Contributing to the Sentry PHP SDK

We welcome contributions to `sentry-php` by the community.

Please search the [issue tracker](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-php/issues) before creating a new issue (a problem or an improvement request). Please also ask in our [Sentry Community on Discord](https://discord.com/invite/Ww9hbqr) before submitting a new issue. There is a ton of great people in our Discord community ready to help you!

If you feel that you can fix or implement it yourself, please read on to learn how to submit your changes.
```

discussion_comments.commented_code:

Please also ask in our [Sentry Community on Discord](https://discord.com/invite/Ww9hbqr) before submitting a new issue. There is a ton of great people in our Discord community ready to help you! + +If you feel that you can fix or implement it yourself, please read a few paragraphs below to learn how to submit your changes.
discussion_comments.comment_body: Looking at https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-python/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, I'm not sure if we should try to align our SDKs or if it's ok to deviate slightly. @vladanpaunovic How do we normally handle these cases?

commented_code:
## Unreleased
 
 - Add missing validation for the `context_lines` option and fix its behavior when passing `null` to make it working as described in the documentation (#1003)
+- Trim path from anonymous class in `Stacktrace` using the `predixes` option (#1016)

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -3,6 +3,7 @@
 ## Unreleased
 
 - Add missing validation for the `context_lines` option and fix its behavior when passing `null` to make it working as described in the documentation (#1003)
+- Trim path from anonymous class in `Stacktrace` using the `predixes` option (#1016)
discussion_comments.comment_body: What do you think about changing this to ``Trim the file path of the frames of the stacktrace that refer to an anonymous class according to the `prefixes` option``?

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -3,6 +3,7 @@
 ## Unreleased
 
 - Add missing validation for the `context_lines` option and fix its behavior when passing `null` to make it working as described in the documentation (#1003)
+- Trim path from anonymous class in `Stacktrace` using the `predixes` option (#1016)
discussion_comments.comment_body: The reason I'm asking this is that it doesn't really makes sense that a file path gets trimmed from a class. What about ``Trim the file path from the anonymous class name in the stacktrace according to the `prefixes` option`` instead?

discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
- Trim the file path from the anonymous class name in the stacktrace according to the `prefixes` option (#1016)
```

There is a space at the start of the line that should not exists. Also I would change the sentence to `The suggested way to create your own instance of the client is to use the provided builder that will take care of instantiating a few dependencies like the PSR-7 factories and the HTTP client`
